title: Replace UPI QR code image with newly uploaded QR

requirements.text: Replace the currently used UPI QR static asset with the newly uploaded QR image, while keeping the frontend code and path unchanged so the app continues to load the QR from `UPI_QR_IMAGE_PATH` (`/assets/generated/upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg`) as used by `frontend/src/utils/upiQrImage.ts` and rendered in `frontend/src/components/donate/UpiPaymentSection.tsx`. Store the replacement file at `frontend/public/assets/generated/upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg`.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/generated/upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg` is replaced with the newly uploaded QR image and is included in the deployed frontend build.
No code changes are required to reference the QR image; `frontend/src/utils/upiQrImage.ts` still exports `'/assets/generated/upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg'`.
On the Donate flow, the QR image renders successfully in the UPI payment section without triggering the QR load error state.
Clicking “Open QR Full Size” opens the same updated QR image in a new tab.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not change the `UPI_QR_IMAGE_PATH` value (`/assets/generated/upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg`) or any other UPI configuration as part of this change.
Do not serve the QR image from the backend; it must remain a static frontend asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated`.
Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Changing the donation flow logic, UTR validation, or admin verification process.
Changing backend donation models or any Motoko canister logic.
Introducing new images beyond replacing the existing UPI QR asset.

edits: Replace the UPI QR code image with the newly uploaded QR design (upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg > upi-qr.dim_800x800.jpg)
